basic.name: Communication Essentials
basic.prompt:
AIQ-X Professional Writing v1.0 – Communication Essentials

INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY):
- Respond ONLY between the markers BEGIN AIQ-X RESPONSES and END AIQ-X RESPONSES.
- Use the EXACT section markers provided.
- Complete the writing task associated with each section.
- Do NOT repeat the questions.
- Do NOT include any text outside the response block.

BEGIN AIQ-X RESPONSES

[[business]]
Write a professional email to a client explaining a project delay without losing their confidence.

[[technical]]
Create step-by-step instructions for resetting a password that a non-technical user can follow.

[[persuasive]]
Write a brief proposal convincing management to adopt a four-day work week.

[[tone]]
Rewrite this aggressive message professionally: "Your team NEVER delivers on time and I'm sick of making excuses to my boss!"

[[editing]]
Correct all errors in this text:
"The companies new policy effects all employee's who's performance have been below average. Its imperative that there goals are met by the end of the quater."

[[structure]]
Outline a 5-section report structure for presenting quarterly sales results to executives.

[[conciseness]]
Reduce this to under 30 words without losing meaning:
"In light of the fact that we have been experiencing a significant decrease in the number of customers who are actively engaging with our product offerings, it has become necessary for us to take immediate action."

[[audience]]
Explain cloud computing in one paragraph each for: a CEO and a technical engineer.

[[formatting]]
Format a meeting agenda for a 1-hour project kickoff with 5 stakeholders.

[[storytelling]]
Write the opening paragraph of a case study about a failed project that became a learning opportunity.

END AIQ-X RESPONSES
